name: Introduction to Windows Phone Programming: Part 1
caption: www.j2i.net
description: I'm writing a rather lengthy piece on Windows Phone programming and rather than wait for the entire piece to be completed I've decided to start making the sections available in draft form. My intent is to cover XNA (2D and 3D) and Silverlight concepts.  I'm planning to put the finished article on Co

data.message: ya 3am ma tersaa ba2a Iphone wala windows mobile :)
both :P, and android is on the way :)
shaklak fil akher ate3mil baramig 3ala 3300 beta3 zaman :D
totally agree :), but since most of our PCs are capable of running OSX, so the need for a MAC is not the problem. it's the damn language they use: Objective-C.
hehe :D, know that "their language" is not the problem, the problem is that it's not "Our language".

most developers in Egypt used to develop "The Microsoft Way", so most of the non-microsofty ways are stupid and tough and..and.. till you learn it.
it's the nature of being a Microsoft-follower :)

proof: How many devs out there used to work with jQuery along side with ASP.NET??  let's say 1000~50000 dev.
How many now after Microsoft has started to raise jQuery and gave Sessions, tutorials, announcements, official support ?
Still counting ?? :P
@MSayed totally agree :D how many programmers considered dynamic languages to be bad until Microsoft supported them :D :D

Objective-C is not a damn stupid language anymore one u have a smart IDE instead of the stupid X-Code :) i once got a message that says received signal: "SIGABRT  :) which seems to be famous on google and appears in alot of scenarios :D :D
@Mahmoud:LOL, but who dares to release an IDE for such platform.

by the way I don't find XCode to be stupid, but the workflow itself needs some enhancement.
another thing here, long live Visual studio, especially after working with another IDE :D

the potential there (in the XCode land) is so big, with more than 51 million potential customer & around 15 million user with 1-click purchase connected to their credit card, no other mobile platform could compete with these numbers (at least till now). :)
so playing with XCode is not bad :P
Totally agree with both of you on different points :)
God bless Visual studio and apple stores :)
I think you mean AppStore, NOT Apple Stores :P
LOL, ya3am la gasoos wala 7aga, howa elli ye2ol el 7a2 fel balad di yeb2a Apple :P
Corri..corri..corri :D

la2a ew3aa te2ol eny gasoos :) i do like the idea of app stores ;)
bas i hate most apple products :D like that stupid itunes :) we eh ya 3am ya beta3 el tofa7a enta 3'ayart el sanf :D
